links.title: There could be a $35 billion market to treat NASH, a 'silent disease' millions are living with - and the competition's starting to heat up
links.description: NASH, short for nonalcoholic steatohepatitis, is a type of liver disease in which liver fat builds up in people. It affects an estimated 16 million Americans, but many don't know it until it leads to more serious problems like liver failure and cirrhosis.
